newsitem.title: GERMANY: German Knorr plans Russian joint venture.
newsitem.headline: German Knorr plans Russian joint venture.

text.p: German brake manufacturing group Knorr-Bremse AG said on Wednesday that it agreed to set up a joint venture with Russian commercial vehicle maker Kamaz AG.
Knorr-Bremse said it had signed a statement of intent with Kamaz on Wednesday to set up the venture, in which it would have a controlling stake.

The German company said its subsidiary Knorr Bremse Systeme fuer Nutzfahrzeuge GmbH, which produces brakes for commercial vehicles, would own 51 percent of the new company and Kamaz would have 49 percent.
Knorr Bremse would supply Kamaz with complete brake systems as part of the deal.
